stanzas: So shall my word be that goeth forth out of my mouth, It shall not return unto me void, but it shall accomplish that which I please, and it shall prosper in the thing whereto I sent it.

He shall go up with joy, and be led forth with peace. The mountains and the hills shall break forth before you into singing. All the trees of the field shall clap their hands it shall not return unto me void.
So shall my word be that goeth forth out of my mouth, It shall not return unto me void, but it shall accomplish that which I please, and it shall prosper in the thing whereto I sent it.

He shall go up with joy, and be led forth with peace. The mountains and the hills shall break forth before you into singing. All the trees of the field shall clap their hands it shall not return unto me void.
